update.description:
This adds visualization markers to gazebo. The interface to markers is through ignition transport. Included in this pull request is a new example stand-alone executable, and `gz marker` command line tool.

The [ignition::msgs::Marker](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-msgs/src/07607e5f1e77eceec0273f6c73cee5aaa5768fe4/ignition/msgs/marker.proto?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default) message type is used to create, modify, and destroy markers.

For command line usage help: `gz marker -h`
update.title: Markers

content.raw:
I didn't really modify your code much. I'll check more thoroughly.

content.html:

content.raw: Cool! Are you using a single line list which increases in size? Or multiple separate segments? (I forgot to mention that I managed to make it work with individual segments, but not one single marker for the whole line).
content.html: Cool! Are you using a single line list which increases in size? Or multiple separate segments? (I forgot to mention that I managed to make it work with individual segments, but not one single marker for the whole line).

content.raw:
Nice plotting tool.

I'm ignoring performance issues right now. Numerous visuals with the same geometry can be handled with instanced geometry in OGRE. Instanced geometry falls outside the scope of this work.

I think your 3d plotting may work better now. I get 60fps with line list. https://youtu.be/egWAMbU7f6Y
content.html:
Nice plotting tool.

I'm ignoring performance issues right now. Numerous visuals with the same geometry can be handled with instanced geometry in OGRE. Instanced geometry falls outside the scope of this work.

I think your 3d plotting may work better now. I get 60fps with line list. https://youtu.be/egWAMbU7f6Y

content.raw:
I tried:

1. `gz marker -m 'action: ADD_MODIFY, type: POINTS, id: 2, point {x:1, y:1, z:0}, point {x:1, y:1, z:1}'` And 2 points appear.

1. Then I want to change that to a line and do `gz marker -m 'action: ADD_MODIFY, type: LINE_STRIP, id: 2, point {x:1, y:1, z:0}, point {x:1, y:1, z:1}'`. But nothing happens.

In fact, even if I just change the position of the points and keep the type the same, nothing seems to change. What am I doing wrong?
content.html:
I tried:

  1. gz marker -m 'action: ADD_MODIFY, type: POINTS, id: 2, point {x:1, y:1, z:0}, point {x:1, y:1, z:1}' And 2 points appear.

  2. Then I want to change that to a line and do gz marker -m 'action: ADD_MODIFY, type: LINE_STRIP, id: 2, point {x:1, y:1, z:0}, point {x:1, y:1, z:1}'. But nothing happens.

In fact, even if I just change the position of the points and keep the type the same, nothing seems to change. What am I doing wrong?

This documentation feels out of place to me. It looks like it could go in the `MarkerManager`, but that class has been purposely excluded from the documentation. 

Who are we targeting this information at? This mentions tools which are out of the scope of the rendering library. Should this go into a tutorial instead?

content.raw: Just a note that this should never return null, except for the world visual. Every visual should have a parent, even if that parent is the world visual. There's a graph [here](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/1613/add-functions-to-get-a-visuals-ancestors/diff) which helps make sense of this.
content.html: Just a note that this should never return null, except for the world visual. Every visual should have a parent, even if that parent is the world visual. There's a graph here which helps make sense of this.

content.raw:
This is really cool and has a very powerful API! I played a bit with it and made a 3d plot plugin :smile: https://youtu.be/2OQc2Njjmcw 

The plugin is in branch [markers_3d_plot](#!/osrf/gazebo/branches/compare/markers_3d_plot%0Dmarkers#diff), but it's not very useful yet.

The plugin is using `SPHERE`, which at 100Hz, quickly overwhelms the render engine. I also tried:

* `LINE_LIST`, appending a point to the message at each iteration and using the same id, so it modifies the previous one. For some reason that was only drawing the beginning of the line and then it stopped. The message seemed to be properly growing though. I didn't investigate much further.

* `POINTS`, adding a new point each iteration, basically the same as for the spheres, but the points weren't showing up. I didn't investigate much more either.
content.html:
This is really cool and has a very powerful API! I played a bit with it and made a 3d plot plugin https://youtu.be/2OQc2Njjmcw

The plugin is in branch markers_3d_plot, but it's not very useful yet.

The plugin is using SPHERE, which at 100Hz, quickly overwhelms the render engine. I also tried:

  • LINE_LIST, appending a point to the message at each iteration and using the same id, so it modifies the previous one. For some reason that was only drawing the beginning of the line and then it stopped. The message seemed to be properly growing though. I didn't investigate much further.

  • POINTS, adding a new point each iteration, basically the same as for the spheres, but the points weren't showing up. I didn't investigate much more either.
